Submodules¶

battleships_project.components module¶

Core components the rest of the modules will import from.

battleships_project.components.create_battleships(filename: str = 'battleships.txt') → dict[str, int]¶

Function used to create battleships based on the battleships.txt file and saves it as a dictionary.

Parameters:

filename – Name of the text file, defaults to “battleships.txt”

battleships_project.components.display_board(board: list[list[str | None]], size: int = 10) → None¶

Function used to check the board state in a visual manner using printlines.

Parameters:

  • board – a list of lists used to simulate a grid

  • size – a integer to define size of the grid, defaults to 10

battleships_project.components.initialise_board(size: int = 10) → list[list[str | None]]¶

Function used to initial a board based on the size chosen. It creates a list of lists.

Parameters:

size – an integer to define size of the grid, defaults to 10

battleships_project.components.place_battleships(board: list[list[str | None]], ships: dict[str, int], style: str = 'simple', algorithm: str = 'Easy', battleshipjson: str = 'placement.json') → list[list[str | None]]¶

Used to choose the right placement function to call

Parameters:

  • board – a list of lists used to simulate a grid

  • ships – a dictionary to hold the battleships and their lengths

  • style – a string to define what placement function is to be called, defaults to ‘simple’

  • algorithm – a string to determine the difficulty of the random placement, defaults to ‘Easy’

  • battleshipjson – a string to point towards the correct json file to use for custom placements, defaults to ‘placement.json’

battleships_project.components.place_battleships_custom(board: list[list[str | None]], ships: dict[str, int], battleshipjson: str) → None¶

Opens the json file specified by its parameters it to decide where to place the battleships.

Parameters:

  • board – a list of lists used to simulate a grid

  • ships – a dictionary to hold the battleships and their lengths

  • battleshipjson – a string to point towards the correct json file to use for custom placements, defaults to ‘placement.json’

battleships_project.components.place_battleships_random(board: list[list[str | None]], ships: dict[str, int], algorithm: str) → None¶

Places the battleships in a random pattern inside the board. This has different difficulty levels chosen by the algorithm that makes the placements more strategic.

Parameters:

  • board – a list of lists used to simulate a grid

  • ships – a dictionary to hold the battleships and their lengths

  • algorithm – a string to determine whether to place ships more strategically or not

battleships_project.components.place_battleships_simple(board: list[list[str | None]], ships: dict[str, int]) → None¶

Places the battleships in a simple formation starting in the top left corner

Parameters:

  • board – a list of lists used to simulate a grid

  • ships – a dictionary to hold the battleships and their lengths
